addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord,
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England

22 May
1591
M
r
Bodeleie to my L.
Taking of
Zutphen./.

page.lettertext:
fol.70r
May it please yo
r
good L. We have worde
from
e Campe, at this very instant, that
e 20 of this moneth,
e towne of Zutphen
after 2 volies of shotte, entred into Parle
w
t
Count Maurice
, and yelded presently
upon it, w
t
condition, to depart w
t
bagge
and baggage. Whiche was done
e same
day before noone: and as every man suppo-
seth, suche diligence and speede was used
by
e Count,
at
e Campe w
t
out stay remoo-
ved upon it, and reached
Deventer
that
night. These good tidinges are
told us by
e mouthe of certaine messengers,
and are only so signified by general worde,
w
t
out any further particularitie. Howbeit
we looke every houre, to knowe some mater
of circumstance, wherein if any thing be
worthy to be imparted to yo
r
L. it shall
be speedely advertised:
And so I take
my humble leave. From
e Hage
May 22 1591
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
